newsitem.title: UK: BAA to boost investment in property - paper.
newsitem.headline: BAA to boost investment in property - paper.

text.p: British airport operator BAA Plc's investment in rented office space and airline-related properties could quadruple to 400 million pounds ($648.6 million) over the next three years, according to Wednesday's Independent.

The newspaper said another option being considered by BAA to unlock value for shareholders is a flotation of its fast-growing discount shopping centre -- owned jointly with U.S. factory mall specialist McArthur-Glen. This could take place by next year.
BAA chief executive Sir John Egan has backed the increase in property spending following the growing demand from airlines for office accommodation and surging rental charges in London.

Property's contribution to BAA's profits has been growing, accounting for about 30 percent of the group's earnings of 397 million pounds in the nine months to December. Most of the new development will be concentrated on Heathrow.

The Independent said subject to approval from McArthur-Glen, BAA would consider floating its discount shopping mall business if its value reached 400 million pounds. Three centres have been completed -- two in England and one in France. Four more are in the pipeline -- three in the UK and one in Austria. ($ = 0.616 British Pounds)
